extendedIngredients.name: baby potatoes
extendedIngredients.original: Steam the baby potatoes until just tender and then cut into eighths, leaving the skin on.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Steam the baby potatoes until just tender and then cut into eighths, leaving the skin on
meta: cut into eighths, leaving the skin on.

extendedIngredients.name: baby potatoes
extendedIngredients.original: The chickpeas and walnuts are joined by steamed baby potatoes, garlic, red onion and fresh peas.
extendedIngredients.originalName: The chickpeas and walnuts are joined by steamed baby potatoes, garlic, red onion and fresh peas

extendedIngredients.name: canned chickpeas
extendedIngredients.original: 400 grams can chickpeas, drained and rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: cooking oil
extendedIngredients.original: Heat a little oil in a skillet over a medium heat and when the pan has heated through, add the onion. Sauté until the onions have softened before adding the garlic.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Heat a little oil in a skillet over a heat and when the pan has heated through, add the onion. Sauté until the onions have softened before adding the garlic

extendedIngredients.name: peas
extendedIngredients.original: Add in the peas and continue to cook until they just start to soften - add in the chickpeas and walnuts
extendedIngredients.originalName: Add in the peas and continue to cook until they just start to soften - add in the chickpeas and walnuts

extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.original: 1 red onion, cut into thick slices
extendedIngredients.originalName: red onion, cut into thick slices

extendedIngredients.name: salad mix
extendedIngredients.original: Place a good mound of salad on the plate and then drape over with slices of swordfish, drizzle the lot with a little extra salmoriglio and serve at once.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Place a good mound of salad on the plate and then drape over with slices of swordfish, drizzle the lot with a little extra salmoriglio and serve at once
meta: with slices of swordfish, drizzle the lot with a little extra salmoriglio and serve at once.

extendedIngredients.name: steak
extendedIngredients.original: The salmoriglio is used to brush over the swordfish steak before it's cooked, tossed through the accompaning vegetables as they are sautéed and finally drizzled over the plated dish.
extendedIngredients.originalName: The salmoriglio is used to brush over the swordfish steak before it's cooked, tossed through the accompaning vegetables as they are sautéed and finally drizzled over the plated dish

extendedIngredients.name: swordfish
extendedIngredients.original: Brush the salmoriglio over both sides of the swordfish and let it infuse until ready to cook.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Brush the salmoriglio over both sides of the swordfish and let it infuse until ready to cook

extendedIngredients.name: sauté until just
extendedIngredients.original: Salt and pepper the fish and then either grill or sauté until just cooked, basting with a little extra salmoriglio. Let it rest for a couple of minutes before slicing it.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Salt and pepper the fish and then either grill or sauté until just cooked, basting with a little extra salmoriglio. Let it rest for a couple of minutes before slicing it
meta: with a little extra salmoriglio. let it rest for a couple of minutes before slicing it.

title: Paper Chef #31 - Warm Swordfish Salad
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Paper Chef #31 - Warm Swordfish Salad a try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 171g of protein, 94g of fat, and a total of 1740 calories. This recipe serves 4 and costs $20.82 per serving. A mixture of lemon juice, the chickpeas and walnuts are joined by baby potatoes, [serves 2], and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the lemon oil you could follow this main course with the Lemon Biscotti as a dessert. This recipe from cookalmostanything.blogspot.com has 1 fans. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and dairy free diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 81%. This score is awesome. Similar recipes are Chargrilled Swordfish on Warm Avocado Corn Salad, Rice Paper Tuna Salad Roll, and Rice Paper Salad Rolls with Ginger Dipping Sauce.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Rabble Pinot Gris with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.
